title: serviceabilityResponse-create-update
description: A response provided by an organization (Seller) to a Serviceability Request made by another organization (Buyer). This Serviceability Response is for a single location. This schema should used for CREATE and UPDATE operations.

status.description: The states used to convey Serviceability Response Status. Values are: {DRAFT, UNDER_REVIEW, RESPONSE_SUBMITTED, ACCEPTED, COMPLETE, REJECTED}.

mpoeOnly.description: Indicates if access to the location is currenly Minimum Point Of Entry (MPOE) only. If mpoeOnly is true, this indicates that full access to the location (e.g. sub-unit or suite) has not yet been established. If mpoeOnly is false or not defined, this indicates that full access to the location has been (or will be) established.

expirationDate.description: The date the Serviceability Response expires, formatted as  YYYY-MM-DD (eg 1997-07-16) or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20+01:00).

perfectMatch.description: Indicates that this response matches exactly the details on the associated serviceability request. This can be useful in differentiating serviceability responses that are upsell or alternatives to the original request.

accepted.description: Indicates if Serviceability Request is accepted. If accepted is true, this indicates the Serviceability Request is accepted.

serviceabilityRequestId.description: The id of the associated Serviceability Request.

buyerId.description: A Party Role played by an Individual or an Organization that buys products and services from a Seller. Specifically, the ID of the Service Provider (Buyer) organization placing the serviceability request.

sellerId.description: An organization that provides products and services to a buyer. Specifically, the ID of the Partner/Access Provider (Seller) organization receiving the serviceability request.

serviceSiteInformation.description: The service site information for the serviceability request.

confidence.description: Serviceability confidence from seller for this request.

installationInterval.description: An estimate of the number of calendar days until the desired service could be activated.

buyerProjectId.description: The project's unique identifier for the buyer project.  An identifier that is used to group Orders that represent a unit of functionality that is important to a buyer. A project can be used to relate multiple orders together.

sellerProjectId.description: The project's unique identifier for a seller project.  An identifier that is used to group Orders that represent a unit of functionality that is important to a buyer. A project can be used to relate multiple orders together.

siteListId.description: The Projects Site List this SRP belongs to

buyerSiteId.description: The Projects Site this SRP belongs to

serviceDetail.description: A response to the serviceability request that contains information about one or more Product Specifications that can be ordered to realize the desired service.
